enWisdom: Cognizance is the light of the heart
Cognizance is the successful attainment of [purification and] the sacred
Cognizance is the evidence of excellence (or nobility)

Wisdom: ذَهَابُ الْبَصَرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ عَمَى الْبَصِيرَةِ
enWisdom: The loss of eyesight is better than the blinding of insight

Wisdom: فَقْدُ الْبَصَرِ أَهْوَنُ مِنْ فِقْدَانِ الْبَصِيرَةِ
enWisdom: Loss of eyesight is easier than loss of insight
For the seeker who achieves what he seeks, there is delight in [his] accomplishment

Wisdom: لَا يَسْتَخِفُّ بِالْعِلْمِ وَأَهْلِهِ إِلَّا أَحْمَقٌ جَاهِلٌ
enWisdom: A little knowledge removes a lot of ignorance

Wisdom: نَظَرُ الْبَصَرِ لَا يُجْدِي إِذَا عَمِيَتِ الْبَصِيرَةُ
enWisdom: Eyesight is of no benefit if insight is blinded

Wisdom: الْمُتَعَبِّدُ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ كَحِمَارِ الطَّاحُونَةِ يَدُورُ وَلَا يَبْرَحُ مِنْ مَكَانِهِ
enWisdom: The worshipper without knowledge is like the donkey that drives a mill, it moves round and round but does not depart from its place

Wisdom: فَاسْمَعُوا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ وَعُوا وَأَحْضِرُوا آذَانَ قُلُوبِكُمْ تَفْهَمُوا
enWisdom: Then listen attentively, O people, and open the ears of your hearts so that you may understand
The perfection of a person is his intellect and his value is his benevolence

Wisdom: يُنْبِئُ عَنْ قِيمَةِ كُلِّ امْرِئٍ عِلْمُهُ وَعَقْلُهُ
enWisdom: A person’s value is indicated by his knowledge and intellect

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَعْرِفِ الْخَيْرَ مِنَ الشَّرِّ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْبَهَائِمِ
enWisdom: Whoever does not know how to distinguish good from evil, then he is [actually] from the beasts

Wisdom: رَأْيُ الشَّيْخِ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ جَلَدِ الْغُلَامِ
enWisdom: The opinion of an elderly person is more beloved to me than the fortitude [and bravery] of a youth
